item.title: BBVA 在竞购竞争对手萨瓦德尔（Sabadell）时放慢了部分招聘速度
item.description: 毕尔巴鄂比斯开亚银行（Banco Bilbao Vizcaya Argentaria SA）在对萨瓦德尔银行（Banco Sabadell SA）进行恶意收购的过程中，放慢了在西班牙本土市场的招聘速度。【原文：Banco Bilbao Vizcaya Argentaria SA has slowed down hiring in its home market Spain as it pursues a hostile takeover of Banco Sabadell SA.】

item.title: 耐克 "鞋类 "商标在欧盟法院看来太过分了
item.description: 耐克公司在与德国运动装备竞争对手彪马公司（Puma SE）关于使用大写字母 "footware "一词的争议中，失去了 "footware "在欧盟的商标权。【原文：Nike Inc. lost the European Union trademark rights to “footware” in a dispute over the use of a capitalized version of the word that pitched it against German sports gear rival Puma SE.】

item.title: 新加坡与马来西亚接近就经济特区达成最终协议
item.description: 新加坡和马来西亚即将敲定开发经济特区的计划，以促进贸易和互联互通。【原文：Singapore and Malaysia are close to finalizing plans to develop a special economic zone that seeks to boost trade and connectivity.】

item.title: 导致塞甘提巨型对冲基金倒闭的微小交易
item.description: 只用了价值 114 万美元的适时交易，就击垮了亚洲顶级对冲基金之一。【原文：It took just $1.14 million worth of well-timed trades to knock down one of Asia’s top hedge funds.】

item.title: 门罗称中东私人信贷 "大幅 "增长
item.description: 私人信用贷款公司门罗资本有限责任公司（Monroe Capital LLC）在阿布扎比设立了新办事处，希望与中东地区的投资者建立长期合作关系。【原文：Private credit lender Monroe Capital LLC is looking to forge long-term partnerships with investors in the Middle East with its new office in Abu Dhabi.】

item.title: 德意志银行新聘 10 名员工，瞄准中东财富市场
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）的财富管理部门正加大在中东地区的招聘力度，该地区已成为吸引全球超级富豪的地方。【原文：Deutsche Bank AG’s wealth management arm is stepping up its recruitment efforts in the Middle East, a region that has become a magnet for the world’s ultra-rich.】

item.title: Uniper 与俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司断绝关系后欧洲天然气价格上涨
item.description: 在德国 Uniper SE 公司因俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司（Gazprom PJSC）未供应的天然气量而被判赔偿超过 130 亿欧元（140 亿美元）之后，欧洲天然气价格跳涨，这增加了来自俄罗斯的剩余燃料流的不确定性。【原文：European natural gas prices jumped after Germany’s Uniper SE was awarded over €13 billion ($14 billion) in damages for unsupplied volumes from Gazprom PJSC, adding uncertainty over remaining fuel flows from Russia.】

item.title: 国际能源署称中国对美国燃料的狂热是最大的石油需求驱动力
item.description: 国际能源机构称，中国从美国购买一种相对小众的燃料，是近年来全球石油需求增长的最大贡献者。【原文：Chinese purchases of a relatively niche type of fuel from the US have been the single biggest contributor to global oil demand growth in recent years, the International Energy Agency said.】

item.title: 国际能源署认为北极项目将使俄罗斯 2030 年石油产量保持稳定
item.description: 据国际能源机构称，尽管受到国际制裁，俄罗斯的石油产量在未来五年仍将保持稳定，因为国营的俄罗斯石油公司（Rosneft PJSC）开始在一个新的大型北极项目中生产石油。【原文：Russia’s oil output will remain stable in the next five years despite international sanctions as state-run Rosneft PJSC starts producing at a major new Arctic project, according to the International Energy Agency.】

item.title: Segantii 香港内幕交易案的关键人物
item.description: Segantii 资本管理公司内幕交易案已被移送至香港更高一级法院，为香港针对大型对冲基金的最高级别法律诉讼之一埋下伏笔。【原文：The Segantii Capital Management insider-dealing case has been moved to a higher court in Hong Kong, setting the scene for one of the highest-profile legal actions against a major hedge fund in the city.】

item.title: 莫迪的主要盟友关联股票成为印度股市的意外赢家
item.description: 本月，在印度南部安得拉邦的一位政治家支持总理纳伦德拉-莫迪组建政府后，该地区的一些公司出现了大幅反弹。【原文：A bunch of companies based in India’s southern state of Andhra Pradesh have rallied hard this month after a politician from the region backed Prime Minister Narendra Modi to form a government.】

item.title: 南非斯帕公司为波兰业务找到买家后大涨
item.description: 南非收入第二大的杂货商斯帕集团有限公司（Spar Group Ltd.）为其陷入困境的波兰分部找到了一个买家，之后斯帕集团有限公司的股价攀升至近九个月来的最高点。【原文：Spar Group Ltd. climbed the most in almost nine months after South Africa’s second-largest grocer by revenue found a buyer for its ailing Polish unit.】

item.title: 欧洲官员称中国电动汽车关税可能在 25% 左右
item.description: 欧洲官员表示，欧盟委员会将于周三向中国电动汽车制造商通报临时关税水平，这些公司可能面临约25%的额外征税。【原文：The European Commission is due to notify Chinese electric-vehicle manufacturers of provisional tariff levels Wednesday and companies could face additional levies of around 25%, European officials said.】

item.title: 药明康德因美国关键制裁法案有望碰壁而大涨
item.description: 药明康德开曼公司（WuXi Biologics Cayman Inc.【原文：Shares in WuXi Biologics Cayman Inc. surged the most in five months on speculation a US bill that can ban Chinese biotechnology firms from doing business may be excluded from the National Defense Authorization Act.】

item.title: 津巴布韦寻求监管加密货币业务的意见建议
item.description: 津巴布韦在制定该行业的监管政策时，要求公众就加密资产业务提供意见。【原文：Zimbabwe has asked for public input on cryptoasset operations as it works on regulatory policy for the sector.】

item.title: 印度零食制造商 Haldiram's 因出售谈判陷入僵局而考虑 IPO
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，由于向外国投资者出售 Haldiram Snacks Pvt Ltd.的计划停滞不前，该公司的所有者正在探讨对这家食品生产商和餐馆运营商进行首次公开募股的可能性。【原文：The owners of Haldiram Snacks Pvt Ltd. are exploring a possible initial public offering for the food producer and restaurant operator as plans to sell it to foreign investors have stalled, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 法国债券大跌颠覆了欧洲债务市场的等级制度
item.description: 随着法国政治风险的爆发，欧洲主权债务市场的等级正在重新排序，法国的债券与那些曾是该地区债务危机核心的债券处于同等地位。【原文：The hierarchy of European sovereign debt markets is being reordered as a flareup in French political risk puts the nation’s bonds on par with those once at the heart of the region’s debt crisis.】

item.title: 苏纳克试图招揽的加密货币公司现在找上了斯塔默
item.description: 就在英国首相苏纳克（Rishi Sunak）出人意料地宣布举行临时大选的前两天晚上，加密货币公司的高管们正在下议院的露台上品酒吃小菜，这是与英国立法者和权力经纪人建立更紧密联系的数月之久的努力的一部分。【原文：Two nights before Prime Minister Rishi Sunak surprised the UK by calling a snap election, crypto executives were sipping wine and eating canapes on a House of Commons terrace, part of a months-long bid to build stronger links with British lawmakers and power brokers.】

item.title: Uniper 与俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司断绝关系，获赔 130 亿欧元
item.description: Uniper SE 因俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司（Gazprom PJSC）自 2022 年年中以来未供应的俄罗斯天然气量而被判赔偿超过 130 亿欧元（140 亿美元）。【原文：Uniper SE was awarded more than €13 billion ($14 billion) in damages for Russian gas volumes not supplied by Gazprom PJSC since mid-2022.】

item.title: 软银债券承销费十年来首次下降
item.description: 软银集团公司十年来首次降低了日元零售债券的承销费，凸显了市场对其信用质量正在改善的看法。【原文：SoftBank Group Corp. was able to reduce underwriting fees for yen retail bonds for the first time in a decade, underscoring the market’s perspective that its credit quality is improving.】

item.title: 印度大选失利后股市反弹速度为十年来最快
item.description: 印度股市以近期历史上最快的速度摆脱了大选的冲击，因为国内投资者利用上周近 4000 亿美元的大跌作为逢低买入的机会。【原文：Indian stocks got over the election shock at the fastest speed in recent history, as domestic investors used the near-$400 billion selloff last week as an opportunity to buy the dip.】

item.title: 下一篇 维勒罗伊说，法国政府需要明确的财政战略
item.description: 法国央行行长弗朗索瓦-维勒鲁瓦-德-加尔豪（Francois Villeroy de Galhau）表示，法国下届政府必须尽快明确其经济政策，因为投资者受到大选的影响而抛售该国债务，并推高了借贷成本。【原文：France’s next government must quickly clarify its economic policy as investors rattled by snap elections sell the country’s debt and drive up borrowing costs, Bank of France Governor Francois Villeroy de Galhau said.】

item.title: 阿布扎比今年首次公开募股交易首日下跌 10
item.description: Alef Education 在阿布扎比首次公开募股募集到 18.9 亿迪拉姆（约合 5.15 亿美元）后股价下跌，这在首次公开募股通常在早盘交易中提供近乎保证收益的中东地区实属罕见。【原文：Alef Education dropped in its Abu Dhabi debut after raising 1.89 billion dirhams ($515 million), a rarity in the Middle East where initial public offerings have typically offered near-guaranteed returns in early trading.】

item.title: 罗马尼亚通胀继续放缓，利率观察家认为降息即将到来
item.description: 罗马尼亚 5 月份的通胀放缓幅度超过预期，这增加了三年多来首次降息的可能性。【原文：Romanian inflation slowed more than expected in May, boosting the chances for the first rate cut in more than three years.】

item.title: KKR 为 Perpetual Buy 筹集 5 亿澳元私人信用贷款
item.description: 据熟悉此事的人士透露，KKR & Co. 同意从 Blackstone Inc.【原文：KKR & Co. agreed to a private credit loan of about A$500 million ($331 million) from Blackstone Inc. and Goldman Sachs Asset Management to help finance its acquisition of Australia’s Perpetual Ltd.’s corporate trust unit, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 潮湿天气抑制零售业发展，英国四月经济停滞不前
item.description: 英国的经济复苏在大选前停滞不前，这对以经济正在好转为竞选筹码的首相苏纳克来说是一个挫折。【原文：Britain’s economic recovery ground to a halt in the run-up to the general election, a setback for Prime Minister Rishi Sunak, who has campaigned on evidence the economy is turning the corner.】

item.title: 中国出口通缩，但美国并未因关系减弱而受益
item.description: 当美国及其盟国谴责中国的工业 "产能过剩 "并准备提高关税作为回应时，那些与中国这个世界工厂建立联系的国家正在努力抑制通货膨胀。【原文：While the US and allies decry China’s industrial “overcapacity” and prepare to sharpen tariffs in response, those embracing links with the factory to the world are getting a hand in their efforts to tame inflation.】
